# Eira Ryyu
*"No one is written in stone. People can change — so be the change." -Eira Ryyu, Director of Heritage*

# Bio
Eira Ryyu is an [Aelorian](/reference/species/aelorian) and the current Director of Heritage for the [Ministry of Heritage.](/reference/species/aelorian/government/heritage) 
## Birthplace and Origins
Originally born male under the name Erion Invisus, she was born and raised in the region of `[LOCATION TBD]`, in the town of `[TOWN TBD]`, which is known for its great imports and exports of all things Aelorian. Due to this, the town is also known for its cultural importance.

Her parents, who remain relatively unknown due to Eira's hesitance to talk about them and her attempts to try and distance herself from who she was born as, tried to push her into continuing the business that had been in the family for a long time — something she had no interest in doing. She was more interested in meeting new people, and learning about the experiences and heritage that made them who they are, and given her personal views and experiences was often very vocal about her reluctance to involve herself in a business that while she viewed as necessary, was also without heart in her mind. As such, she often involved herself in cultural affairs such as holidays, the arts, and public events where she started to grow a name for herself as an avid supporter of the cultural upbringing of the Aelorians.

As Eira grew in age, she also grew in confidence in what she believed in, and who she was. It was at this point that she began to name herself Eira, as well as identifying her gender as female. Her parents did not see this as necessary or worthwhile, and often tried to dissuade her from continuing such "silly games."

When Eira became of age to start working, her first applications were sent directly to the Ministry of Heritage, where she had dreams of working at. It wasn't long before she heard back from them, and was accepted into an introduction position. Given her outgoing and avid support of their cultures and society, the Ministry offered her a place to stay within the city where the Ministry's headquarters reside — `[HEADQUARTERS TBD.]` Despite her parents' attempts and pleas to not go, to do the job they expected her to do, she accepted the offer, and moved to the city. From there, she legally changed her name to Eira Ryyu, and started working.
